title: Defense Minister Rajnath Singh dedicates 29 bridges and six roads to strengthen the safety at borders | India News - News9live
text: Dehradun: The state and union territories, located on the borders, got an infrastructural boost as defense minister Rajnath Singh inaugurated 35 projects including six roads and 29 bridges. Uttarakhand, Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh and Mizoram are among these states and UTs. Border road Organisation has played a key role in construction of these projects costing around Rs. 670 crores. Jammu & Kashmir gets maximum bridges With ten bridges and one road in Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh has six bridges and three roads. Along with this, 3 bridges in Uttarakhand, 01 bridge in Himachal Pradesh, 02 roads in Sikkim, 08 bridges in Arunachal Pradesh and 1 bridge is in Mizoram. In the state of Uttarakhand, Dhak Bridge and Bhapkund Bridge on the Joshimath-Malari road connecting the India-China border and Rimkhim Garh Bridge on the Sumna-Rimkhim motor road, all three bridges have been built by Shivalik Project at a cost of Rs 33.24 crore. These bridges will help in making transportation easier in border areas. Defense Minister lauded the BRO Appreciating the service of the Border Roads Organization (BRO), the defense minister said that timely completion of any project has been possible due to the commitment of the organization. He also called for working in an environmentally friendly manner with the mantra of maximum national security and welfare. The defense minister lauded BRO for strengthening the country's border infrastructure. Rajnath Singh also made special mention of the contribution of BRO in the recently launched Silkyara Tunnel Operation to rescue stranded laborers in Uttarakhand. The government is committed to development of border areas Defensee minister said that under the leadership of PM Modi, the government is committed to the development of border areas keeping in mind the security needs of the country. “We do not consider these areas as buffer zones. They are part of our mainstream”. CM Dhami congratulated Defense Minister Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed his gratitude on the inauguration of development projects of border areas. The Chief Minister said that under the leadership of Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi, work on big projects has been started considering the strategic, religious and environmental importance of the state. Schemes like Char-Dham All Weather Road, Rishikesh-Karnprayag Railway Line, Frontier Area Development Project and Parvatmala are important from the point of view of development as well as security. The Chief Minister congratulated and congratulated the entire team of BRO for giving impetus to the infrastructure development work in the border areas.
